009
010package imagingbook.common.threshold.adaptive;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.threshold.Thresholder.BackgroundMode;
013
014import ij.plugin.filter.RankFilters;
015import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.DialogLabel;
017import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
018
019
020/**
021 * <p>
022 * This is an implementation of the adaptive thresholder proposed by Bernsen in
023 * [1]. It uses a circular support region implemented with ImageJ's built-in
024 * rank-filter methods. See Sec. 9.2.1 of [2] for a detailed description.
025 * </p>
026 * <p>
027 * [1] J. Bernsen. Dynamic thresholding of grey-level images. In "Proceedings of
028 * the International Conference on Pattern Recognition (ICPR)", pp. 1251â€“1255,
029 * Paris (October 1986). IEEE Computer Society. <br>
030 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
031 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
032 * </p>
033 * 
034 * @author WB
035 * @version 2022/04/02
036 */
037public class BernsenThresholder implements AdaptiveThresholder {
038        
039        /**
040         * Parameters for class {@link BernsenThresholder}.
041         */
042        public static class Parameters implements ParameterBundle<BernsenThresholder> {
043                /** Radius of circular support region */ 
044                @DialogLabel("Radius")
045                public int radius = 15;
046                
047                /** Minimum contrast */ 
048                @DialogLabel("Min. contrast")
049                public int cmin = 15;
050                
051                /** Background type (see {@link BackgroundMode}) */
052                @DialogLabel("Background mode")
053                public BackgroundMode bgMode = BackgroundMode.DARK;
054        }
055        
056        // --------------------------------------------
057        
058        private final Parameters params;
059        
060        /**
061         * Constructor using default parameters.
062         */
063        public BernsenThresholder() {
064                this.params = new Parameters();
065        }
066        
067        /**
068         * Constructor using specified parameters.
069         * @param params an instance of {@link Parameters}
070         */
071        public BernsenThresholder(Parameters params) {
072                this.params = params;
073        }
074
075        @Override
076        public ByteProcessor getThreshold(ByteProcessor I) {
077                final int M = I.getWidth();
078                final int N = I.getHeight();
079                ByteProcessor Imin = (ByteProcessor) I.duplicate();
080                ByteProcessor Imax = (ByteProcessor) I.duplicate();
081
082                RankFilters rf = new RankFilters();
083                rf.rank(Imin, params.radius, RankFilters.MIN);
084                rf.rank(Imax, params.radius, RankFilters.MAX);
085
086                int q = (params.bgMode == BackgroundMode.DARK) ? 256 : 0;
087                ByteProcessor Q = new ByteProcessor(M, N);
088
089                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
090                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
091                                int gMin = Imin.get(u, v);
092                                int gMax = Imax.get(u, v);
093                                int c = gMax - gMin;
094                                if (c >= params.cmin)
095                                        Q.set(u, v, (gMin + gMax) / 2);
096                                else
097                                        Q.set(u, v, q);
098                        }
099                }
100                return Q;
101        }
102        
103}
